void NMI_Handler (void)
 This function handles NMI exception.

 This function handles SVCall exception.

 This function handles PendSVC exception.

 This function handles SysTick Handler.
void GPIO_Configuration (void)
 Configure the GPIO as below. AFIO Mode : GPIO Mode Default Value : RESET Pull Resistor : Pull-DISABLE Output Driving Current: 8mA Direction : Output.
void GPIO_LockStatus (void)
 Determine the lock state of specified GPIO port and Pin. GPIO Port A is Locked. GPIO Port A Pin 1 is Locked. GPIO Port A Pin 2 is unLocked.
void GPIO_LockPinTest (void)
 Lock Pin Test. (Port A Pin 1) PA1 is Locked, so changing PA1 GPIO Configuration is invalid. After changing GPIO Configuration, PA1 GPIO Configuration as below: AFIO Mode: GPIO Mode Default Value : RESET Pull Resistor : Pull-DISABLE Output Driving Current: 8mA Direction : Output Result => PA1 Toggle Ten Times, because PA1 is Locked (Change Configuration is invalid) PA1: (Output -> Output) Mode, (Pull-Disable -> Pull-Disable)
void GPIO_OtherPinTest (void)
 Other Pin Test. (Port A Pin 2) PA2 is UnLocked, so changing PA2 GPIO Configuration is valid. After changing GPIO Configuration, PA2 GPIO Configuration as below: AFIO Mode : GPIO Mode Default Value : RESET Pull Resistor : "Pull-Up" Output Driving Current: 8mA Direction : "Input" Result => PA2 keeps the high level, because PA2 is unlocked (Change Configuration is valid) PA2: (Output -> Input) Mode, (Pull-Disable -> Pull-Up)
int main (void)
 Main program.

Function Documentation

void GPIO_Configuration ( void  )

Configure the GPIO as below. AFIO Mode : GPIO Mode Default Value : RESET Pull Resistor : Pull-DISABLE Output Driving Current: 8mA Direction : Output.

Return values:
None
void GPIO_LockPinTest ( void  )

Lock Pin Test. (Port A Pin 1) PA1 is Locked, so changing PA1 GPIO Configuration is invalid. After changing GPIO Configuration, PA1 GPIO Configuration as below: AFIO Mode: GPIO Mode Default Value : RESET Pull Resistor : Pull-DISABLE Output Driving Current: 8mA Direction : Output Result => PA1 Toggle Ten Times, because PA1 is Locked (Change Configuration is invalid) PA1: (Output -> Output) Mode, (Pull-Disable -> Pull-Disable)

Return values:
None

Definition at line 166 of file example/GPIO/PinLock/main.c.

void GPIO_LockStatus ( void  )

Determine the lock state of specified GPIO port and Pin. GPIO Port A is Locked. GPIO Port A Pin 1 is Locked. GPIO Port A Pin 2 is unLocked.

Return values:
None

Definition at line 120 of file example/GPIO/PinLock/main.c.

void GPIO_OtherPinTest ( void  )

Other Pin Test. (Port A Pin 2) PA2 is UnLocked, so changing PA2 GPIO Configuration is valid. After changing GPIO Configuration, PA2 GPIO Configuration as below: AFIO Mode : GPIO Mode Default Value : RESET Pull Resistor : "Pull-Up" Output Driving Current: 8mA Direction : "Input" Result => PA2 keeps the high level, because PA2 is unlocked (Change Configuration is valid) PA2: (Output -> Input) Mode, (Pull-Disable -> Pull-Up)

Return values:
None
